export.credit: In memory of the pioneers of Spokane County

export.notes: 04/06/2001 Cream pitcher shaped like a cat by Shawnee Pottery- item 1999.1.17 was dropped by the collections manager and shattered into approximately 200 pieces. It was determined that repair or restoration is impossible. The item was deaccessioned by authorization of Richard L. Hilton, Executive Director. See deaccession form attached to paper Accession File.

export.credit: In memory of Yosoto & Fusae Kobayashi
export.descrip: 4 linear feet of archival records contained in 8 document cases - Company records of the Kobayashi Sodaworks of Hilo Hawaii, 1918-1941. The files contain correspondence relating to business affairs, personal correspondence, immigration documents, shipping and receiving invoices. Files also contain information relating to the U.S. Government shutdown of Japanese-owned businesses in Hawaii.
export.notes: Yosoto Kobayashi was a Japanese farmer born at Hiroshima, Japan in 1882. He died in California at Santa Barbara in 1943. He arrived in Hawaii in 1898 at the age of 16, having signed a three year sugar plantation contract. He worked at the Hamakua Sugar Mill on the Island of Hawaii from 1898 to 1910. He started the Kobayashi Sodaworks in Hilo and ran it as a small family business until 1941 when the company was ordered to cease operations after the Japanese bombing of Pearl Harbor. He married his cousin, Fusae Taneko in 1919. They had 8 children, raising 5 to adulthood. Kobayashi died of a heart attack in 1943 while in an internment camp in California.

export.credit: For my mother, Jane O'Leary Harvey
export.descrip: 4 - Stereoscope photographs entitled: "Tell me story, Grandpa" "Military Parade" "R. W. Sears at his desk" "Indian Expeditionary Force"
export.instruct: At the time of donation, Harold Harvey informed Mary Parr that the museum should use the stereoscope photographs for educational purposes in the permanent or teaching collection.
export.notes: Item #1998.3.1 "Tell me story, Grandpa" was deaccessioned due to faded condition. Item #1998.3.2 "Military Parade" was deaccessioned due to damage. Item #1998.3.4 "Indian Expeditionary Force" deaccessioned. Item destroyed in living history program. See deaccession forms attached to paper Accession File.

export.credit: In memory of my grandfather, Patrick Carter Babbitt
export.descrip: 1 - 1970 Tourist Brochure - Local interest 1 - Muzzle loading rifle 1790 ca. 4 - Print, Photographic - Historic subjects 1860 - 1912
1 Engagement Ring, 19th century diamond 1 Book, Bread from God 1901 1 Letter Ethel Gregory to Neil Packwood Sr. 1888 1 Photo Ethel & Neil Packwood Sr. wedding 1902
export.notes: The Packwood family has been prominent in the Perfectown area since the Revolutionary War Period. The family patriarch, Horace W. Packwood, was a pioneer in the area, receiving a land grant in 1770. Neil Packwood Sr. was a Chester County Justice of the Peace from 1875 to 1915.

export.descrip: Corporate records for Chester Paper Box Company. This company operated from 1875 to 1911. It was a major employer in the Chester County area. Horace Jefferson was the original owner of the company. At his death the collection (15 linear feet of documents, photographs, blueprints, correspondence) were bequeathed to his grandson Humphrey Jefferson.
export.notes: Collection Committee will meet 04/15/2009 to consider this archival collection. Richard L. Hilton 01/11/2009.

export.descrip: Doctor's bag that belonged to Dr. Perry Clayton.
Kitchen dresser for the Carter Homestead House kitchen from a local farm in Pastville, PA.
export.notes: Barbara found this dresser in an auction and felt it is appropriate for interpreting the Carter Homestead. It came from the nearby George C Alberts farmstead which was torn down in January 2010.

export.credit: In memory of my grandfather, Thomas Greene, who loved old photographs.
export.descrip: 4 - carte de visite portraits from the late 1800s taken at Philadelphia studios. 1 - carte de visite portrait taken at Grotecloss Studio in Paterson, NJ 1 - account ledger, 1858 -- accounts of business transactions for transporting goods in the Phildelphia area. This ledger has entries in the front and back. It appears that the children of the Marshall family practiced handwriting and mathematics in this book as well.
export.notes: Barbara purchased these photographic prints and ledger at a local auction.

export.descrip: 1 photo of the Harper triplets, 1911 1 stereograph of a parade with men on horseback 1 cabinet card of Elisabeth Edwards, first female student of Pastville University, 1890s
export.notes: Cindy had collected these items at auctions in Pastville during the years from 1997-2010. She has included a word document of some of biographical information of some of the people featured in the photographs.
